question: A ceiling fan is rotating around a fixed axle as shown. The direction of angular velocity along
images/q30_diagram.png
explanation: Using the right-hand rule for the direction of rotation shown (clockwise looking from top, or counter-clockwise looking from bottom - diagram shows arrow curling around vertical axis). Assuming standard coordinate system shown (Z up, Y right, X out?).
The diagram shows rotation around the vertical axis. If the curl is clockwise when viewed from above, the vector points downwards.

The diagram shows the Z axis vertical. The rotation arrow suggests direction. Based on standard conventions and the answer key D (<katex>$-\hat{k}$</katex>), the angular velocity vector points in the negative z-direction.
